content:
Hi there,

Is there any particular reason why 1.15.3 is still marked as being the latest release on GitHub?
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/latest

I was using the above URL for getting the latest version to check all my Backdrop sites up against if they where up-to-date or not.
But since 1.16.1 i couldn't use that anymore.

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.

Hello @Søren Bonde :wave: ...I believe that it is simply a matter of order (time-wise) of when the release tags have happened. Although https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/tags seems to be sorted by tag number, if you hover your mouse over the time of the tag creation, you will see that 1.15.3 was created on May 20, at 22:21 EEST, whereas 1.16.1 has been created at 22:18. ...I guess we need to make this part of our release process, and make sure that we cut the tag for the previous minor version before the next minor. ( cc @Nate Lampton )

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.

... https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22822586/swap-latest-release-on-github has a comment that describes a way to "fix" this, but it would involve deleting the 1.16.1 tag, and then re-creating it with a fake date (which makes me uneasy).

Swap "Latest release" on github
I have a repository on a github. Here is the graph: Here is my action sequence: Make 5 commits and push them Add a tag v0.2.0 (git tag -a v0.2.0 -m "release 0.2.0") Push the tag (git push --tags

@klonos OK, thanks for your reply. :-)
Didn't notice the creation time. Makes sense then. :-)
I don't think that this has ever happened to us before :sweat_smile: ...guess we'll be more careful next time.

Hehe, there's a first time for everything. ;-)
No problem, thanks for clearing it up. :-)
Yup. ...anyway, I think that we have some bug fixes lined up for a 1.16.2 release, so this issue will be short-lived.

Sounds good! :-)
Will keep an eye on the next release and update my URL to check for latest release accordingly.

klonos said:

I don't think that this has ever happened to us before :sweat_smile: ...guess we'll be more careful next time.

It happens to us occasionally on sec releases; drush makes use of that latest release URL too and the drush users notice it
I guess we may need to create the backport release first
not sure if just cutting the tag first and pushing up to GH is sufficient or not
